item.title: Jennah add a quote by Guy Gavriel Kay
item.description: "We must be what we are, or we become our enemies. " -- Guy Gavriel Kay

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "A good traveler has no fixed plans and is not intent on arriving." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "You know how every now and then, you have a moment where your whole life stretches out ahead of you like a forked road, and even as you choose one gritty path you've got your eyes on the other the whole time, certain that you're making a mistake." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Styron
item.description: "A great book should leave you with many experiences, and slightly exhausted at the end. You live several lives while reading." -- William Styron

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "It is a curious thing, the death of a loved one. We all know that our time in this world is limited, and that eventually all of us will end up underneath some sheet, never to wake up. And yet it is always a surprise when it happens to someone we know. It is like walking up the stairs to your bedroom in the dark, and thinking there is one more stair than there is. Your foot falls down, through the air, and there is a sickly moment of dark surprise as you try and readjust the way you thought of things." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The Guide says there is an art to flying", said Ford, "or rather a knack. The knack lies in learning how to throw yourself at the ground and miss." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jennah add a quote by David Gemmell
item.description: "Old age is not as honorable as death, but most people seek it." -- David Gemmell

item.title: Jennah add a quote by David Gemmell
item.description: "I would have offered you a forest of truth, but you wish to speak of a single leaf" -- David Gemmell

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Isaac Asimov
item.description: "The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds the most discoveries, is not "Eureka!" (I found it!) but 'That's funny..." -- Isaac Asimov

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Christian de Duve
item.description: "life is either a reproducible, almost commonplace manifestation of matter, given certain conditions, or a miracle. Too many steps are involved to allow for something in between." -- Christian de Duve

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Sidney W. Mintz
item.description: "Most of us, most of the time, act within plays the lines of which were written long ago, the images of which require recognition, not invention." -- Sidney W. Mintz

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "To see a World in a Grain of Sand And a Heaven in a Wild Flower, Hold Infinity in the palm of your hand And Eternity in an hour." -- William Blake

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "The imagination is not a state: it is the human existence itself." -- William Blake

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "What is now proved was once only imagined." -- William Blake

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Blake
item.description:
"A DIVINE IMAGE
Cruelty has a human heart, And Jealousy a human face; Terror the human form divine, And Secresy the human dress.
The human dress is forged iron, The human form a fiery forge, The human face a furnace sealed, The human heart its hungry gorge." -- William Blake

item.title: Jennah add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "You never know what is enough unless you know what is more than enough." -- William Blake

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Humans need fantasy to be human. To be the place where the falling angel meets the rising ape." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Evan D.G. Fraser
item.description: "Eating connects us to our histories as much as it connects our souls to our bodies, our bodies to the earth." -- Evan D.G. Fraser

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Evan D.G. Fraser
item.description: "...eating is the purest mode of consumption. Our purchases are statements about our social class, our friends, and our beliefs. Buying something as continually necessary as food is an ongoing act of self-definition." -- Evan D.G. Fraser

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Andrew Rimas Evan D.G. Fraser
item.description: "The aristocrats had to force them to do their jobs. After all, human beings are not badgers. We aren't molded to stoop." -- Andrew Rimas Evan D.G. Fraser

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "The beauty of the day is the only thing that doesn't fade in time. Day after day, such beauty revives itself." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Gregory Maguire
item.description: "What is strange is that we may remember what we have done, but not always why we did it." -- Gregory Maguire

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Miyamoto Musashi
item.description: "Think lightly of yourself and deeply of the world" -- Miyamoto Musashi

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Like many human beings, he took the least sign of conversation as his cue to make noise." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "To live is to be marked. To live is to change, to acquire the words of a story, and that is the only celebration we mortals really know." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Every betrayal contains a perfect moment, a coin stamped heads or tails with salvation on the other side. Betrayal is a friend I have known a long time, a two-faced goddess looking forward and back with a clear, earnest suspicion of good fortune." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The power is in the balance: we are our injuries, as much as we are our successes." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Jennah add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "Illusions mistaken for truth are the pavement under our feet. They are what we call civilization." -- Barbara Kingsolver
